resources.string: UVCE then called ‘College of Engineering’ was established at Bengaluru in 1917 just a year after the University of Mysore was established, giving a fillip to higher education and to enable the students of Mysore State to play their part in the Engineering field.

Initially, two branches of engineering namely, Civil and Mechanical Engineering were started. College of Engineering (UVCE) was the 5th Engineering College of the country and first in the Princely State of Mysore.

UVCE currently offers 

 1. Seven Undergraduate (B.E/B.Arch) 
 2. Twenty-Four Postgraduate (M.E/M.Arch.) 
 3. Three Part time BE evening under graduate courses. 
 4. M.Sc. (Engineering) byResearch, 
 5. Three-Year full time Ph.D., 
 6. Four-Year part time Ph.D. programmes in all disciplines. 
 7. Ph.D. (QIP) programme in Civil Engineering
 
The total intake of the college is about 1200 students a year.
Alumni are the vital asset for any educational institution. UVCE being a century old college finds its alumni spread widely across globe.

Alumni association aims to gather its strong alumni network and build a better UVCE with its various initiatives like, 

 1. Lecture series 
 2. Providing scholarship 
 3. Corpus funds 
 4. Awarding achievers 
 5. Planning Centenary building 
 6. Community service
The alumni association strives to keep its members informed about the activities that happen in the college through its newsletter. \n\n Website: http://uvcealumni.org/index.html
The UVCE Foundation was created by alumni, faculty and well-wishers of UVCE in 2003 to help in restoring the glory of UVCE.
It has members from around the world and has already executed various projects at UVCE to address immediate needs of the students of UVCE.

UVCE Foundation has been growing in strength ever since its inception and has been widely recognized as a strong support from the college authorities. The objective of the Foundation is to restore the ‘top-ten’ status the college.\n\nWebsite: http://uvcefoundation.org

VisionUVCE is a group of UVCE alumni who are focussed on \"Giving Back to UVCE\" by creating awareness among the strong alumni and make them understand the potential that the creation of an alumni group, working for the betterment of college brings about.

It is VU\'s responsibility to make sure, the flag of our alma mater flies high in the air and also as proud alumni of this college, there is a need to take part in the operations involved with the institution.

Major programs held under VISION UVCE:

 1 Sampada – A monthly magazine that offers you a ride though UVCE
 2 VU scholarship – Every year scholarships are provided to those in need
 3 VU champs – Recognition of efforts of Student Volunteers
 4 Parichaya – A detailed profile of UVCE’s great alumni
 5 Samvaada – Occasional meet between alumnus, current staff and students
 6 VU also supports and funds various student initiatives which seems promising in terms of idea and its reach. It's also involved in taking care of student\’s utility in campus by funding to the required cause. VU raises its fund from alumni of UVCE.
